title: Digital Production-Based Scientific Inquiry Learning Design and Formative Assessment Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge (core concepts in physics, chemistry, and biology) and experience using digital devices, along with a basic understanding of the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: A science-related job competency development course requiring smartphone-centric digital content creation and learning design in limited-technology environments. Focuses on implementing actual scientific inquiry processes (experimental data visualization, variable control analysis, scientific evidence-based conclusions) with digital tools.

learning_goals: Learners create smartphone-based digital learning objects (infographics, videos, etc.) explaining science concepts (e.g., ecosystem interactions, chemical reactions)

Learners participate in formative assessment processes to improve their instructional design outputs via peer evaluation, validating the validity of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formulation-experiment design-data analysis-conclusion drawing)

Using a teacher-provided PBL framework (e.g., 5-stage problem-solving process), learners design and execute ≥3 science problem-solving projects (e.g., environmental pollution measurement experiments, physics law application designs) over multiple cycles, submitting deliverables meeting ≥2 of 3 evaluation criteria per project (problem definition clarity, solution process systematicity, result validity)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
